conbody.p: Pattern-matching functions allow you to find regular expression patterns in strings or attributes. Regular expressions can formally represent various string search patterns using different special characters to indicate wildcards, positional characters, repetition, optional or mandatory sequences of letters etc. N1QL functions are available to find matching patterns, find position of matching pattern, or replace a pattern with a new string.

For more information on all supported REGEX patterns, see https://golang.org/pkg/regexp/syntax/Couchbase Server 4.x N1QL supports regular expressions supported by The Go Programming Language version 1.4.2.

dlentry.dd: expression: string, or any N1QL expression that evaluates to a string
pattern: string representing a supported regular expression
Returns True if the string value contains the regular expression pattern.

dd.codeblock: SELECT name FROM `travel-sample` WHERE type = "landmark" AND REGEX_CONTAINS(name, ".*In+") LIMIT 2;

dlentry.dd: expression: string, or any N1QL expression that evaluates to a string
pattern: string representing a supported regular expression
Returns True if the string value contains the regular expression pattern.

dd.codeblock: SELECT name FROM `travel-sample` WHERE type = "hotel" and REGEX_LIKE(name, "In+.*") LIMIT 4;

dlentry.dd: expression: string, or any N1QL expression that evaluates to a string
pattern: string representing a supported regular expression
Returns first position of the occurrence of the regular expression pattern within the input string expression. Returns -1 if no match is found. Position counting starts from zero.
The following query finds positions of first occurrence of vowels in each word of the name attribute.

dd.codeblock: SELECT name, ARRAY REGEX_POSITION(x, "[aeiou]") FOR x IN TOKENS(name) END FROM `travel-sample` WHERE type = "hotel" LIMIT 2;

dlentry.dd: expression: string, or any N1QL expression that evaluates to a string
pattern: string representing a supported regular expression
repl: string, or any N1QL expression that evaluates to a string
n: the maximum number of times to find and replace the matching pattern

dd.p: Returns new string with occurrences of pattern replaced with repl. If n is given, at the most n replacements are performed. If n is not provided, all matching occurrences are replaced.

dlentry.dd: In this example, the query retrieves first 4 documents and replaces the pattern of repeating n with emphasized ‘NNNN’.
